Summary statistics of a numeric array.

eda.stats.Rd

Generates summary statistics of mean, median, skew, kurtosis, min, max and quartiles.

Usage

eda.stats(x)

Arguments

x

numeric array

Details

requires timeDate library

Value

Named list with the following items:

summary

min, 1st quartile, median, mean, 3rd quartile, max

skew

skewness

kurt

kurtosis

Author

Garry Grabow

See also

eda.shape, summary,skewness, kurtosis

Examples

require(timeDate)
#> Loading required package: timeDate
# summary statistics for random normal data
# mean of 1. sd = 0.3
ndata<-rnorm(25,1,.3)
eda.stats(ndata)
#> $summary
#>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
#>  0.5469  0.8224  0.9781  0.9933  1.0873  1.5612 
#> 
#> $skew
#> [1] 0.325651
#> attr(,"method")
#> [1] "moment"
#> 
#> $kurt
#> [1] -0.5173448
#> attr(,"method")
#> [1] "excess"
#> 
#summary statistics for right-skewed data
#mean of 1, sd=1
rdata<-rexp(25,rate=1)
eda.stats(rdata)
#> $summary
#>    Min. 1st Qu.  Median    Mean 3rd Qu.    Max. 
#> 0.06764 0.36842 0.88993 1.28740 1.20240 5.87025 
#> 
#> $skew
#> [1] 1.803217
#> attr(,"method")
#> [1] "moment"
#> 
#> $kurt
#> [1] 2.294393
#> attr(,"method")
#> [1] "excess"
#>
